Reading.title: Reading
Reading.name: Paper 1
Reading.paper_structure: The paper consists of five questions, totaling 50 marks: three short-answer questions covering inference and vocabulary and don't need to refer the question that it is the inference or vocab (5 marks each), two opinion-based and passage analysis questions (5 marks each), one key points extraction question from a passage (10 marks), and one summary writing question (120–150 words) worth 15 marks.
Reading.content: Based on two reading texts, including comprehension and summary tasks

Writing.title: Writing
Writing.name: Paper 2
Writing.paper_structure: The paper consists of two questions, totaling 50 marks: one 25-mark question requiring a 250–350 word discursive, argumentative, persuasive, or informative response based on provided texts, and one 25-mark question where candidates write a 350–450 word descriptive or narrative composition.
Writing.content: Candidates produce different forms of writing such as articles, reports, letters, or speeches

subject_content: Writing in various styles and for different audiences
